com.esri.mo2.xml.prj
Class MapProject

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.esri.mo2.xml.prj.MapProject
All Implemented Interfaces:
Project
public final class MapProject
extends Object
implements Project

This class contains functionality to handle loading/saving of an ArcXML1.1(Standard ArcXML) configuration file (default file extension is "*.axl").

Here is an example of using the class to load a Standard ArcXML file:
     //precondition: String absolutePath, com.esri.mo2.map.core.Map map;
     //precondition: import com.esri.mo2.xml.prj.UserCredentialHandler chandler;
      MapProject aimsProject = new MapProject(absolutePath);
      aimsProject.setRegisteredEnvironment(new Environment());
      aimsProject.setRegisteredMap(map);
      aimsProject.load(chandler);

Here is an example of using the class to save a Standard ArcXML file:
      //precondition: String absolutePath, com.esri.mo2.map.core.Map map;
      MapProject aimsProject = new MapProject(absolutePath);
      aimsProject.setRegisteredEnvironment(new Environment());
      aimsProject.setRegisteredMap(map);
      aimsProject.save();

load

public void load(UserCredentialsHandler cHandler)
          throws IOException
Description copied from interface: Project
Loads the project from file.
You can call this method multiple times to reload from the same file if desired.

Reads the file and populates the contents of components that have been registered for serialization. Using this method you will get an opportunity to type username and password to get access to a restricted resource ( to a restricted ArcIMS map service, for instance).

Specified by:
load in interface Project
Throws:
IOException - if any problem reading the file

save

public void save()
          throws IOException
Description copied from interface: Project
Saves the project to file
You can call this method multiple times to save to the same file if desired.

Serializes all components that have been registered for serialization and writes them to the file.

Specified by:
save in interface Project
Throws:
IOException - if any problem writing the file
